org.restsql.core

Interface RequestLogger


  • public interface RequestLogger
    Logs request for troubleshooting applications. The implementation logs requests to access, error and trace logs.
    Author:
    Mark Sawers

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSql(String sql)
      Adds a SQL statement generated during request processing.
      List<String> getSql()
      Returns list of SQL statements generated during request processing.
      void log(int responseCode)
      Logs exceptional response without an exception.
      void log(int responseCode, Exception exception)
      Logs exceptional response with an exception.
      void log(String responseBody)
      Logs normal response.
      void setHttpRequestAttributes(HttpRequestAttributes httpRequestAttributes)
      Sets attributes of an HTTP request.
      void setRequest(Request request)
      Sets request.

    • Method Detail

      • addSql

        void addSql(String sql)
        Adds a SQL statement generated during request processing. Used by the framework.

      • getSql

        List<String> getSql()
        Returns list of SQL statements generated during request processing. Intended for Java API clients.

      • log

        void log(int responseCode)
        Logs exceptional response without an exception. Used by the service or Java API client.

      • log

        void log(int responseCode,
       Exception exception)
        Logs exceptional response with an exception. Used by the service or Java API client.

      • log

        void log(String responseBody)
        Logs normal response. Used by the service or Java API client.

      • setRequest

        void setRequest(Request request)
        Sets request. Used by Request implementation.

      • setHttpRequestAttributes

        void setHttpRequestAttributes(HttpRequestAttributes httpRequestAttributes)
        Sets attributes of an HTTP request. Used by service when request is unauthorized prior to restSQL Request creation.
